sen.j: 木沢 長政（きざわ ながまさ、明応2年（1493年）? － 天文 (元号)11年3月17日 (旧暦)（1542年4月2日））は、戦国時代 (日本)の人物。
sen.e: Nagamasa KIZAWA (1493? - April 2, 1542) was a person in the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States) in Japan.
Nagamasa KIZAWA (1493? - April 2, 1542) was a person in the Sengoku (Warring States) period of Japan.
Nagamasa KIZAWA (1493? - April 12, 1542) was a man in the Warring States period of Japan.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。April 12→April 2（グレゴリオ歴）

sen.j: 河内国、山城国南部の守護代。
sen.e: He was Shugodai (deputy of Shugo, provincial constable) of Kawachi Province and southern Yamashiro Province.
He was the Shugodai (a deputy of the Shugo, provincial constable) of Kawachi Province and southern Yamashiro Province.
He was the a deputy of the provincial constable of Kawachi Province and southern Yamashiro Province.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 左京亮。
sen.e: He was Sakyo no Suke (name of official rank).
He was Sakyo no Suke (the title of his official rank).
He had the title of Sakyo no Suke.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 河内飯盛山城城主、大和国信貴山城城主。
sen.e: He was castellan of Kawachi Iimoriyama-jo Castle and Shingisan-jo Castle in Yamato Province.
He was a castellan of Kawachi Iimoriyama-jo Castle and Shingisan-jo Castle in Yamato Province.
He was a castellan of Kawachi Iimoriyamajo Castle and Shingisanjo Castle in Yamato Province.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 父は木沢浮貶（左近?）か。
sen.e: His father is assumed to be Uhen (Sakon?) KIZAWA.
It is assumed that Uhen (Sakon?) KIZAWA was his father.
Some say that Uhen (Sakon?) KIZAWA was his father.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 木沢左馬允は弟。
sen.e: Samojo KIZAWA is his younger brother.
Samojo KIZAWA was his younger brother.
Samojo KIZAWA was his younger brother.

sen.j: 木沢右近、木沢又八郎は一族か。
sen.e: Ukon KIZAWA and Matahachiro KIZAWA are assumed to be members of his clan.
It is assumed that Ukon KIZAWA and Matahachiro KIZAWA were members of his clan.
Some say that Ukon KIZAWA and Matahachiro KIZAWA were members of his clan.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 生涯
sen.e: Biography
Biography
Biography

sen.j: 木沢氏は畠山氏の被官として名が見える一族である。
sen.e: Kizawa clan is a family which their name is seen as vassals of the Hatakeyama clan.
The Kizawa clan was a family whose name is seen among the vassals of the Hatakeyama clan.
The Kizawa clan was a family whose name is seen among the vassals of the Hatakeyama clan.

sen.j: 畠山持国の時代には木沢蓮因なる人物がいたことが知られている。
sen.e: A person with name of Renin KIZAWA is known in the period of Mochikuni HATAKEYAMA.
A person called Renin KIZAWA is known from the period of Mochikuni HATAKEYAMA.
Renin KIZAWA is known from the period of Mochikuni HATAKEYAMA.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 長政の時代において、主家の畠山氏は総州家と尾州家に分かれて対立しており、当初は畠山義就を祖とする畠山総州家の畠山義堯に仕えていた。
sen.e: In the period of Nagamasa, his master Hatakeyama clan was divided into Soshu family and Bishu family, opposing against each others, and at first Nagamasa served to Yoshitaka HATAKEYAMA of Hatakeyama Soshu family, which has Yoshinari HATAKEYAMA as their ancestor.

In the period of Nagamasa, his master, the Hatakeyama clan, was divided into the Soshu and Bishu families, in mutual opposition, and at first Nagamasa served Yoshitaka HATAKEYAMA of the Hatakeyama Soshu family, which had Yoshinari HATAKEYAMA as its ancestor.

During the period of Nagamasa, his master's family the Hatakeyama clan was divided into the Soshu and Bishu families in opposition to each other; at first, Nagamasa served Yoshitaka HATAKEYAMA of the Hatakeyama Soshu family, which had Yoshinari HATAKEYAMA as its ancestor.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: だが、相克を続ける主家を見限るかのように、次第に独自の行動をするようになっていく。
sen.e: However, like giving up his conflicting master family, he gradually started to take his individual actions.
However, as he gave up his conflicting master family he gradually started taking action independently.
However, as he gave up his master's family with internal trouble, he gradually started taking action independently.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 細川氏へ取り入って自らの地位向上に努める中、政敵の排除には一向宗と法華宗の宗教対立まで利用する狡猾さを見せた。
sen.e: He tried to rise up his position by gaining Hosokawa clan's favor, and to eliminate his political enemies, he showed cunningness to use religious conflict between Ikko sect and Hokke sect.
He tried to elevate his position by gaining the favor of the Hosokawa clan, and to eliminate his political enemies he showed the cunning of using religious conflict between the Ikko and Hokke sects.
He tried to elevate his position by gaining the favor of the Hosokawa clan, and to eliminate his political enemies he showed the cunning of using religious conflict between the Ikko and Hokke sects.

sen.j: やがては主家を牛耳るほどの勢力を一代で築き上げ、畿内にその名を轟かせた。
sen.e: Before long, he gained power to control his master family in his generation, and his name became to be known widely throughout Kinai region.
Eventually, he gained power sufficient to control his master family in his own generation, and his name became known throughout the Kinai region.
Finally, he gained power enough to control his master family in his own generation, which made his name known throughout the Kinai region.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: しかし、増長したため孤立し、最後は三好長慶に敗れ、戦死を遂げた。
sen.e: However, he became isolated because he had been puffed up, and in the end, he lost against Nagayoshi MIYOSHI and died in the battle.
However, he became isolated because he had been puffed up, and in the end he lost against Nagayoshi MIYOSHI and died in the battle.
He became isolated, however, because he had been bid-headed, and in the end he lost against Nagayoshi MIYOSHI and died in the battle.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 権謀術数を駆使して
sen.e: Making full use of scheming
Making full use of scheming
Make full use of scheme
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: その当時、平島公方・足利義維を擁して細川氏の管領職争いを優位に進めつつあった細川晴元（晴元）へ接近。
sen.e: At that time, he approached to Harumoto HOWOKAWA, who was about to gain advance in the dispute over position of Kanrei (shogunal deputy) in Hosokawa clan by backing up Yoshitsuna ASHIKAGA, who was also called Hirashima Kubo.

At that time, he approached Harumoto HOWOKAWA, who was about to gain an advantage in the dispute over the position of Kanrei (shogunal deputy) in the Hosokawa clan by supporting Yoshitsuna ASHIKAGA, who was also called Hirashima Kubo.

In those days, he approached Harumoto HOSOKAWA, who was about to gain an advantage in the dispute over the position of Kanrei (shogunal deputy) in the Hosokawa clan, by supporting Yoshitsuna ASHIKAGA, who was also called Hirashima Kubo.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: しかし享禄4年（1531年）、六郎（晴元）の仇敵・細川高国による摂津国侵攻の際には、当初は勢い盛んな高国軍との対峙を危ぶんでか、一時的に姿を消す。
sen.e: However in 1531, when Takakuni HOSOKAWA, a sworn enemy of Rokuro (Harumoto), made invasion to Settsu Province, maybe fearing to confront against Takakuni army which was forceful at first, he disappeared temporarily.

However, in 1531, when Takakuni HOSOKAWA, a sworn enemy of Rokuro (Harumoto), invaded Settsu Province, perhaps fearing a confrontation with the Takakuni army which was forceful at first, he temporarily disappeared.

However, in 1531, when Takakuni HOSOKAWA, a sworn enemy of Rokuro (Harumoto), invaded Settsu Province, he temporarily disappeared probably in fear of a confrontation with the Takakuni army which was forceful at first.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: ところが、天王寺の戦い（大物崩れ）で高国を破って切腹に追い込んだ六郎（晴元）たち堺公方派の勝利が確定した頃になると再び姿を現し、高国方の要人である細川尹賢を捕縛し、切腹させている。
sen.e: However, when the victory of Sakaikubo group, Rokuro (Harumoto) and others, became definite by defeating Takakuni in the battle of Tennoji (Daimotsukuzure) and forcing him into Seppuku (suicide by disembowelment), he showed up again, captured Tadatake HOWOKAWA, who was a leading figure of Takakuni side, and made him to do Seppuku.

However, when the victory of the Sakaikubo group, Rokuro (Harumoto) and others became definite by defeating Takakuni in the battle of Tennoji (Daimotsukuzure) and forcing him to commit seppuku (suicide by disembowelment), he showed up again, captured Tadatake HOWOKAWA, who was a leading figure of the Takakuni side, and made him commit seppuku.

However, when the victory of the Sakaikubo group, Rokuro (Harumoto) and others became definitely by defeating Takakuni in the battle of Tennoji (Daimotsukuzure) and forcing him to commit seppuku (suicide by disembowelment), Renin showed up again, captured Tadatake HOWOKAWA, who was a leading figure of the Takakuni side, and made Tadatake commit seppuku.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: なお、主君・義堯も六郎（晴元）の姉妹が正室であった縁にも因るのか、堺公方の足利義維を支持する一員であった。
sen.e: Further, maybe because Yoshitaka, his master, had Rokuro's sister as his lawful wife, he was also a member to support Sakaikubo, Yoshitsuna ASHIKAGA.
Moreover, perhaps because Yoshitaka, his master, had Rokuro's sister as his lawful wife, he was also a member in support of Sakaikubo, Yoshitsuna ASHIKAGA.
Besides, he was also a member in support of Sakaikubo, Yoshitsuna ASHIKAGA probably because his master Yoshitaka had Rokuro's sister as his lawful wife.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: だが、高国という共通の外敵を滅ぼすと堺公方派の連合には、結束にヒビが入りはじめた。
sen.e: However, after eliminating their common enemy Takakuni, the unity of Sakaikubo group began to crack.
However, after eliminating their common enemy Takakuni, the unity of the Sakaikubo group began to crack.
After eliminating their common enemy Takakuni, however, the unity of the Sakaikubo group began to crack.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: その原因は、六郎（晴元）にあった。
sen.e: The cause was in Rokuro (Harumoto).
The cause was in Rokuro (Harumoto).
Rokuro (Harumoto) was the cause.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 義維（堺公方）派の中心人物でありながら、対立してきた将軍足利義晴との和睦を図ろうとする六郎（晴元）の方針に、晴元の有力家臣である三好元長が諫言。
sen.e: Motonaga MIYOSHI, who was a powerful vassal of Harumoto, remonstrated against the policy of Rokuro (Harumoto) to try to make peace with shogun, Yoshiharu ASHIKAGA, who had been opposing with them, even though he was the main person of Yoshitsuna (Sakaikubo) group.

Motonaga MIYOSHI, who was a powerful vassal of Harumoto, remonstrated against the policy of Rokuro (Harumoto) to try to make peace with the shogun, Yoshiharu ASHIKAGA, who had been opposing them, even though he was the main person of the Yoshitsuna (Sakaikubo) group.

Even though Motonaga MIYOSHI, a powerful vassal of Harumoto, was the main person of the Yoshitsuna (Sakaikubo) group, he remonstrated against the policy of Rokuro (Harumoto) to try to make peace with the shogun Yoshiharu ASHIKAGA, who had been opposing them.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 義堯も諌止側に回るなど、両者は次第に対立するようになっていた。
sen.e: Yoshitaka also stood in the side of dissuasion, and both of them gradually began to oppose against each others.
Yoshitaka also stood on the side of dissuasion, and both of them gradually began to oppose each other.
Both of them gradually began to oppose each other such that Yoshitaka also stood on the side of dissuasion.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: そんな中、主家・畠山氏を飛び越えて、六郎（晴元）への接近を強めんとする長政の姿勢は、これを危険視する主君・義堯と三好元長の結束を招いてしまう。
sen.e: In this situation, Nagamasa's attitude to make close approach to Rokuro (Harumoto), jumping over his master family, Hatakeyama clan, resulted in the unity of his master Yoshitaka and Motonaga MIYOSHI, who both regarded it dangerous.

In this situation, Nagamasa's attitude of making a close approach to Rokuro (Harumoto) and jumping over his master family (the Hatakeyama clan) resulted in the unity of his master Yoshitaka and Motonaga MIYOSHI, who both regarded it as dangerous.

In this situation, Nagamasa's attitude of making a closer approach to Rokuro (Harumoto) over a head of his master family (the Hatakeyama clan) resulted in the unity of his master Yoshitaka and Motonaga MIYOSHI, who both regarded it as dangerous.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 誅滅される危険に晒された長政は、三好氏の中で元長を敵視する三好政長の存在に着目。
sen.e: Nagamasa, who faced danger to be executed, directed his attention to Masanaga MIYOSHI, who was regarding Motonaga as an enemy in Miyoshi clan.
Nagamasa, who risked execution, directed his attention to Masanaga MIYOSHI, who regarded Motonaga as an enemy in the Miyoshi clan.
Nagamasa, who risked execution, paid attention to Masanaga MIYOSHI, who regarded Motonaga as an enemy in the Miyoshi clan.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 政長と共謀して六郎（晴元）へ元長を讒言することにより、元長と六郎（晴元）を離間させること成功した。
sen.e: By conspiring with Masanaga to slander Motonaga against Rokuro (Harumoto), he succeeded to estrange Motonaga and Rokuro (Harumoto).
By conspiring with Masanaga to slander Motonaga against Rokuro (Harumoto), he succeeded in estranging Motonaga and Rokuro (Harumoto).
He succeeded in estranging Motonaga and Rokuro (Harumoto) by conspiring with Masanaga to slander Motonaga against Rokuro (Harumoto).
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 義堯と元長からは2度に亘って居城の飯盛山城を攻撃され、劣勢であったところを、享禄5年6月（1532年）には六郎（晴元）の要請により出陣した一向一揆の援軍を得て、これを撃退。
sen.e: When he was in inferior position after his residential castle, Iimoriyama-jo Castle, was attacked twice by Yoshitaka and Motonaga, in June 1532, he gained reinforcements of Ikko Ikki (an uprising of Ikko sect followers) who came to battle with Rokuro's (Harumoto) request, and repulsed them.

When he was in an inferior position after his residential fortress, Iimoriyama-jo Castle, was attacked twice by Yoshitaka and Motonaga, in June 1532 he encountered the reinforcements of the Ikko Ikki (an uprising of Ikko sect followers), who had come to fight at Rokuro's (Harumoto) request, and repulsed them.

He was in an inferior position as his residential fortress Iimoriyamajo Castle was attacked twice by Yoshitaka and Motonaga, but in July and August 1532, he encountered the reinforcements of the Ikko Ikki (an uprising of Ikko sect followers), who had come to fight at Rokuro's (Harumoto) request, and repulsed them.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 窮地を乗り切った。
sen.e: He escaped from predicament.
He escaped the predicament.
He escaped the difficult situation.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: この時の一向一揆の進撃は凄まじく、主君・義堯を自刃させたばかりか、畿内における三好氏の根拠地・和泉国顕本寺 (堺市)まで襲って元長も自害に追い込み、堺公方を消滅させている。
sen.e: The attack of Ikko Ikki at the situation was tremendous, and not only they made his master Yoshitaka commit suicide with a sword, but also they drove Motonaga into suicide by raiding the base of Miyoshi clan in Kinai region, Kenpon-ji Temple in Izumi Province, vanishing the Sakaikubo.

The attack by the Ikko Ikki in that situation was tremendous, for not only did they cause his master Yoshitaka to commit suicide with a sword but they also drove Motonaga to suicide by raiding the base of the Miyoshi clan in the Kinai region, Kenpon-ji Temple in Izumi Province, whereupon the Sakaikubo were vanished.

The Ikko Ikki in that situation attacked so tremendous that they not only caused his master Yoshitaka to commit suicide with a sword but also raided the base of the Miyoshi clan in the Kinai region, Kenponji Temple in Izumi Province (Sakai City) to drove Motonaga to suicide, whereupon the Sakaikubo were extinguished.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 一向宗と法華宗の対立を利用して政敵の排除に成功したまでは良かったが、長政の思惑を通り越して、そのまま今度は大和国へ転進する一向一揆軍。
sen.e: It was a success until he had eliminated his political enemies by using the conflict between the Ikko clan and the Hokke clan, but beyond the expectation of Nagamasa, Ikko Ikki army turned its way into Yamato Province.

It was a success until he had eliminated his political enemies by using the conflict between the Ikko clan and the Hokke clan, but beyond the expectation of Nagamasa, the Ikko Ikki army turned and entered Yamato Province.

Although he successfully eliminated his political enemies by using the conflict between the Ikko clan and the Hokke clan, the Ikko Ikki army turned and entered Yamato Province beyond the expectation of Nagamasa.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 大和では興福寺などの他宗派との衝突や、暴動を起こすなど新たな騒乱を巻き起こしてしまう（享禄・天文の乱天文の錯乱）。
sen.e: In Yamato, they made disturbance by colliding with other religious sects and starting riots (Kyoroku Tenbun Disturbance, Tenbun War).
In Yamato, they caused a disturbance by colliding with other religious sects and starting riots (such as the Kyoroku Tenbun Disturbance and the Tenbun War).
In Yamato, they caused a disturbance by colliding with some other religious sects such as Kofuku-ji Temple and starting riots such as the Kyoroku Tenbun Disturbance and the Tenbun War.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: その為、将軍義晴の下で管領となった晴元の命令を受けて、長政はその対応と鎮圧に追われることになる。
sen.e: Because of that, by receiving order from Harumoto, who had become Kanrei under the shogun Yoshiharu, Nagamasa became busy corresponding and suppressing the Ikko Ikki.
Consequently, having received the order from Harumoto, who had become Kanrei under the shogun Yoshiharu, Nagamasa became busy with correspondence and the suppression of the Ikko Ikki.
Consequently, having received the order from Harumoto, who had become Deputy to the Shogun under Shogun Yoshiharu, Nagamasa became busy with taking action and suppressing the Ikko Ikki.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: そこで今度は一向一揆と対立する法華一揆と結び、その力で一向一揆を追討した。
sen.e: Therefore, he allied with Hokke Ikki, who were opposing against Ikko Ikki, and using their power, he searched and attacked Ikko Ikki.
Therefore, he allied with the Hokke Ikki, who were in opposition to the Ikko Ikki, and using their power he sought out and attacked the Ikko Ikki.
Then, he allied with the Hokke Ikki, who opposed the Ikko Ikki, and using their power he sought out and attacked the Ikko Ikki.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 一向一揆の勢力を弱めることに成功すると、今度は法華一揆が邪魔になったため、天文5年（1536年）にこれを打倒した（天文法華の乱）。
sen.e: After succeeding in weakening of the power of Ikko Ikki, this time, the Hokke Ikki became a nuisance, and in 1536, he attacked and defeated them (Tenbun Hokke Disturbance).
With the power of the Ikko Ikki successfully reduced, the Hokke Ikki became a nuisance, and in 1536 he attacked and defeated them (the Tenbun Hokke Disturbance).
When he successfully reduced the power of the Ikko Ikki, the Hokke Ikki became a nuisance; in 1536, he attacked and defeated them (the Tenbun Hokke Disturbance).
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: その後、本願寺の証如や蓮淳と書簡や進物のやり取りを盛んに行い、一向宗との関係修復に努めた。
sen.e: After that, he endeavored to repair the relationship between the Ikko sect by actively exchanging letters and gifts with Shonyo and Renjun of Hongan-ji Temple.
Subsequently, he endeavored to repair the relationship between the Ikko sect by actively exchanging letters and gifts with Shonyo and Renjun of Hongan-ji Temple.
Thereafter, he managed to repair the relationship with the Ikko sect by actively exchanging letters and gifts with Shonyo and Renjun of Hongan-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: こうして長政は畿内の実力者の一人として認識されるようになる。
sen.e: In this way, Nagamasa had become to be recognized as one of powerful men in Kinai region.
In this way, Nagamasa became recognized as one of the powerful men in the Kinai region.
In this way, Nagamasa became recognized as one of the influential persons in the Kinai region.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 両畠山家の掌握
sen.e: Taking control of both Hatakeyama families
Taking control of both Hatakeyama families
Having a command of both Hatakeyama families
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 河内畠山氏においては、既に総州家は没落していたが、一方の尾州家（畠山政長を祖とする）の勢力は健在であった。
sen.e: As for Kawachi Hatakeyama clan, Soshu family had already been ruined, but on the other hand, the power of Bishu family (its ancestor is regarded as Masanaga HATAKEYAMA) was still thriving.

As for the Kawachi Hatakeyama clan, the Soshu family had already been ruined, but on the other hand the power of the Bishu family (whose ancestor is regarded to be Masanaga HATAKEYAMA) was still thriving.
The Soshu family had already been ruined in the Kawachi Hatakeyama clan, but on the other hand, the Bishu family whose ancestor is regarded to be Masanaga HATAKEYAMA was still thriving.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 天文_(元号)3年（1534年）当時、尾州家の主は畠山稙長であったが、長政は尾州家重臣の遊佐長教らと結託して稙長を紀伊国に追放した。
sen.e: At the time of 1534, the head of Bishu family was Tanenaga HATAKEYAMA, but by conspiring with Bishu family's senior vassal, Naganori YUSA and others, Nagamasa banished Tanenaga to Kii Province.
At that time, in1534, the head of the Bishu family was Tanenaga HATAKEYAMA, but by conspiring with the family's senior vassal Naganori YUSA and others, Nagamasa banished Tanenaga to Kii Province.
At that time of 1534, the head of the Bishu family was Tanenaga HATAKEYAMA, but Nagamasa banished Tanenaga to Kii Province by conspiring with the family's senior vassal Naganori YUSA and others.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 当初は稙長の弟・畠山長経（左京大夫）を傀儡として擁立したが、晴元の干渉もあって長経は廃され、今度はそのまた弟の畠山政国（播磨守?）と総州家より畠山在氏を擁立し、尾州家と総州家の共同統治という形式を採ることにより、長政は長教と共に畠山氏の実権を握ることになる。
sen.e: At first, they backed Tanenaga's young brother, Nagatsune HATAKEYAMA (Sakyo no Daibu, or the master of the Eastern Capital Offices) as their puppet, but by interference from Harumoto, Nagatsune was abolished, and this time they backed Nagatsune's young brother Masakuni HATAKEYAMA (Harima no Kami, or the governor of Harima Province?) and Ariuji HATAKEYAMA from Soshu family, taking form of joint sovereignty, which made Nagamasa, with Naganori, hold the actual power of Hatakeyama clan.

Initially, they backed Tanenaga's younger brother, Nagatsune HATAKEYAMA (Sakyo no Daibu, or the master of the Eastern Capital Offices) as their puppet, but due to interference from Harumoto, Nagatsune was abolished, so instead they backed Nagatsune's younger brother Masakuni HATAKEYAMA (Harima no Kami, or the governor of Harima Province?) and Ariuji HATAKEYAMA from the Soshu family, taking the form of joint sovereignty, whereby Nagamasa, along with Naganori, held the reins of the Hatakeyama clan.

Initially, they made a pupppet of Tanenaga's younger brother Nagatsune HATAKEYAMA, the master of the Eastern Capital Offices, but due to interference from Harumoto, Nagatsune was dedposed; then, they backed Nagatsune's younger brother Masakuni HATAKEYAMA, the governor of Harima province? and Ariuji HATAKEYAMA from the Soshu family to take the form of joint sovereignty, whereby Nagamasa, along with Naganori, held the reins of the Hatakeyama clan.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: その後の長政の野心は、河内1国を支配下に治めただけにはとどまらず、その軍事行動は畿内の各国に及んだ。
sen.e: After that, the ambition of Nagamasa didn't stop by only ruling 1province, Kawachi, and his military actions extended to each provinces in Kinai region.
After that, Nagamasa's ambition didn't stop with the rule of a single province, Kawachi; instead, his military actions extended to each province in the Kinai region.
Since then, Nagamasa's ambition didn't stop with the rule of only a single province Kawachi, but his military actions extended to each province in the Kinai region.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 特に、かつての総州家の版図である大和国への執着は根強く、国人衆にとって大きな脅威となった。
sen.e: Especially, his persistence against Yamato Province, which was Soshu family's territory in the past, was tenacious, and became a great threat for the Kokujinshu (local samurais).
Particularly, his persistence against Yamato Province, which had been the Soshu family's territory in the past, was tenacious, becoming a great threat for the Kokujinshu (local samurais).
He was particularly tenacious of Yamato Province, the Soshu family's past territory, which became a great threat for the local samurai 'Kokujinshu'.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: この時河内と大和の双方に通じる拠点として信貴山城や二上山城 (大和国)を築城した。
sen.e: At this time he constructed Shingisan-jo Castle and Nijozan-jo Castle (Yamato Province) as footholds leading to both Kawachi and Yamato.
At this time he constructed Shingisan-jo Castle and Nijozan-jo Castle (Yamato Province) as footholds leading to both Kawachi and Yamato.
At this time he constructed Shingisanjo Castle and Nijozanjo Castle (Yamato Province) as footholds which lead to both Kawachi and Yamato.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 転機
sen.e: Turning point
The turning point
The turning point

sen.j: 畿内では新たに元長の遺児である三好長慶や摂津の有力国人である池田信正（久宗）が台頭するようになっていた。
sen.e: In Kinai, a child of late Motonaga, Nagayoshi MIYOSHI and powerful Kokujin in Settsu, Nobumasa (Hisamune) IKEDA were newly rising.
In Kinai, a child of the late Motonaga, Nagayoshi MIYOSHI, and the powerful Kokujin in Settsu, Nobumasa (Hisamune) IKEDA, were emerging.
In Kinai, Nagayoshi MIYOSHI, a child of the late Motonaga, and Nobumasa (Hisamune) IKEDA, the powerful Kokujin in Settsu, were emerging.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 長慶の帰参を取り成したのは長政で、これは法華宗と和睦する際に、法華宗とつながりの深い三好氏の助力を得る必要があったためである。
sen.e: It was Nagamasa who interceded Nagayoshi to return to service, because he needed a help of Miyoshi clan, who were connected deeply with Hokke clan, to make peace with Hokke clan.

It was Nagamasa who interceded with Nagayoshi to return to service, because he needed the help of the Miyoshi clan, who were deeply connected with the Hokke clan, in order to make peace with the Hokke clan.

It was Nagamasa who interceded with Nagayoshi to return to service; this was because that as the Miyoshi clan was deeply connected with the Hokke clan, Nagamasa needed the help of the Miyoshi clan in order to make peace with the Hokke clan.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 年少ながら晴元政権でしだいに頭角を現していた長慶は、当初は父の仇の一人である晴元と敵対するも和睦。
sen.e: At first, Nagayoshi, who was beginning to stand out in Harumoto government, opposed against Harumoto, one of enemies who killed his father, but later made peace.
At first, Nagayoshi, who was beginning to stand out in the Harumoto government, had opposed Harumoto, among the enemies that had killed his father, but later he made peace.
Nagayoshi, who was beginning to stand out in the Harumoto government despite being young, first opposed Harumoto among the enemies that had killed his father, but later, made peace with Harumoto.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 摂津越水城を与えられると畿内に勢力を着実に広げ、長政に押領された父・元長の旧領奪回を狙っていた。
sen.e: After given Settsu Koshimizu-jo Castle, he steadily spread his power in Kinai and aimed at regaining the former territory of his father Motonaga, which was confiscated by Nagamasa.
After receiving Settsu Koshimizu-jo Castle, he steadily spread his power in Kinai and sought to regain the former territory of his father Motonaga, which had been confiscated by Nagamasa.
After receiving Settsu Koshimizujo Castle, Nagayoshi steadily expanded in Kinai and sought to regain the former territory of his father Motonaga, which had been confiscated by Nagamasa.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: こうした外部での情勢変化以上に問題となったのが、畠山家中における主導権を巡っての遊佐長教との対立である。
sen.e: A situation which troubled more than these changes in external conditions was a conflict between Naganori YUSA over the initiative in the Hatakeyama family.
A situation more troubling than these changes in external conditions was a conflict with Naganori YUSA over the initiative in the Hatakeyama family.
A problem more serious than these changes in external conditions was a conflict with Naganori YUSA over the initiative in the Hatakeyama family.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 旧主の畠山稙長と和睦してまで長政の排斥を目論む遊佐長教に対抗すべく、蓮淳の仲介で管領・細川晴元との関係強化を図ったが、これに失敗する。
sen.e: To oppose against Naganori YUSA, who had even schemed to drive out Nagamasa by making peace with his former master, Tanenaga HATAKEYAMA, he planned to strengthen relationship with Kanrei, Harumoto HOSOKAWA through intermediation of Renjun, but he failed.

To oppose Naganori YUSA, who had even schemed to drive out Nagamasa by making peace with his former master, Tanenaga HATAKEYAMA, he planned to strengthen the relationship with Kanrei, Harumoto HOSOKAWA, through the intermediation of Renjun, but he failed in that attempt.

To oppose Naganori YUSA, who had even schemed to drive out Nagamasa by making peace with his former master Tanenaga HATAKEYAMA, he planned to strengthen the relationship with Kanrei, Harumoto HOSOKAWA through the intermediation of monk Renjun, but failed in that attempt.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 事情は不明だが先に廃した畠山長経も殺害しており、長政の畠山家中での増長の兆しがこの頃には見えるようになっていた。
sen.e: The reason is not clear, but he killed Nagatsune HATAKEYAMA, who was abolished in the past, and sign of puffing up of Nagamasa in the Hatakeyama family could be seen in around this period.
The reason isn't clear, but he killed Nagatsune HATAKEYAMA, who had once been ousted, and during this period there were signs that Nagamasa's image in the Hatakeyama family was being inflated.
The reason isn't clear but he killed Nagatsune HATAKEYAMA, who had once been ousted, and during this period, there were signs that Nagamasa became big-headed in the Hatakeyama family.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 凋落へ
sen.e: Going downhill
Going downhill
Declining
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 天文10年（1541年）には、旧高国党とみなされた山下城の塩川政年の処遇を巡って晴元や長慶と対立。
sen.e: In 1541, he opposed against Harumoto and Nagayoshi over treatment of Masatoshi SHIOKAWA, who was regarded as former Takakuni group.
In 1541, he opposed Harumoto and Nagayoshi over the treatment of Masatoshi SHIOKAWA, who was regarded as being of the former Takakuni group.
In 1541, he opposed Harumoto and Nagayoshi about the treatment of Masatoshi SHIOKAWA (the Yamashitajo Castle) who was regarded as being of the former Takakuni group.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: そこで長政は、摂津の有力国人である伊丹親興や三宅国村を味方につけ、これに抵抗した。
sen.e: Therefore, Nagamasa allied with Chikaoki ITAMI and Kunimura MIYAKE, who were powerful Kokujin in Settsu, to compete with them.
Therefore, Nagamasa became allied with Chikaoki ITAMI and Kunimura MIYAKE, who were powerful Kokujin in Settsu, in order to compete with them.
Therefore, in order to compete with them, Nagamasa allied himself with Chikaoki ITAMI and Kunimura MIYAKE, who were powerful local samurai in Settsu.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 一庫城を包囲していた長慶と信正を敗走させ、信正の原田城を攻撃、さらに京へ進軍して、将軍義晴を擁立しようと画策するが、肝心の義晴には近江坂本へ逃れられてしまい、長政は幕府に背いた逆賊となってしまう。
sen.e: He routed Nagayoshi and Nobumasa, who were surrounding Hitokuro-jo Castle, attacked Nobumasa's Harada-jo Castle, and schemed to back up shogun Yoshiharu, but the essential Yoshiharu escaped to Sakamoto in Omi Province, making Nagamasa to become a rebel against the bakufu.

He routed Nagayoshi and Nobumasa, who had surrounded Hitokuro-jo Castle, attacked Nobumasa's Harada-jo Castle, and schemed to back up Shogun Yoshiharu, but the essential Yoshiharu escaped to Sakamoto in Omi Province, causing Nagamasa to become a rebel against the bakufu.

He withdrew Nagayoshi and Nobumasa who had envelopped Hitokurojo Castle; attacked Nobumasa's Haradajo Castle and advanced on Kyoto; and schemed to back up Shogun Yoshiharu, but the essential Yoshiharu escaped to Sakamoto in Omi Province, which caused Nagamasa to become a rebel against the bakufu.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: しかも、早々に晴元と和睦した政年や国村の離反によって、孤立感を深めた。
sen.e: Moreover, with defects of Masatoshi and Kunimura, who quickly made peace with Harumoto, his isolation became stronger.
Moreover, with the defections of Masatoshi and Kunimura, who quickly made peace with Harumoto, he became more isolated.
Moreover, with the defections of Masatoshi and Kunimura who quickly made peace with Harumoto, he became more isolated.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 翌11年（1542年）には、河内高屋城で政変が勃発。
sen.e: In the next year, 1542, a coup broke out in the Kawachi Takaya-jo Castle.
The next year, 1542, a coup broke out in Kawachi Takaya-jo Castle.
In the next year 1542, a coup broke out in Kawachi Takayajo Castle.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 木沢派の家臣が粛清され、さらに畠山政国が追放された。
sen.e: Vassals of Kizawa group were purged, and Masakuni HATAKEYAMA was banished.
The vassals of the Kizawa group were purged, and Masakuni HATAKEYAMA was banished.
The vassals of the Kizawa group were executed, and Masakuni HATAKEYAMA was banished.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: その後は、遊佐長教との関係を修復した畠山稙長が当主に復帰した。
sen.e: After that, Tanenaga HATAKEYAMA, who repaired the relationship with Naganori YUSA, returned as the head of the family.
Eventually, Tanenaga HATAKEYAMA, who had repaired the relationship with Naganori YUSA, returned as the head of the family.
Tanenaga Hatakeyama returned as the head of the family by eventually repairing his relationship with Nagori Yusa.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 河内畠山尾州家における支持基盤を失い、ますます窮地に立たされた長政に従うのは、柳生家厳など、かつての総州家の被官を中心とする大和国人衆の一部のみであった。
sen.e: Ones who follow Nagamasa, who had lost backing base in Kawachi Hatakeyama Bishu family and had been made to stand in increasingly difficult situation, were only part of Yamato Kokujinshu, mainly former vassals of Soshu family, such as Ieyoshi YAGYU.

Those who had followed Nagamasa, who had lost his backing base in the Kawachi Hatakeyama Bishu family and had been made to withstand an increasingly difficult situation, were only part of Yamato Kokujinshu, mainly as former vassals of the Soshu family, such as Ieyoshi YAGYU.

Nagamasa had lost his backing base in the Kawachi Hatakeyama Bishu family and had been made to withstand an increasingly difficult situation; therefore, only part of Yamato Kokujinshu, mainly as former vassals of the Soshu family, such as Ieyoshi YAGYU had followed Nagamasa.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 高屋城の再奪取を図るも失敗し、幕府の追討軍と河内太平寺の戦いで一戦するも、細川晴元、三好長慶、遊佐長教の連合軍に敗れ、討ち死にした。
sen.e: He schemed but failed to re-seize Takaya-jo Castle, and even though he fought against bakufu's hunting army in the battle of Kawachi Taiheiji, he was defeated by joint army of Harumoto HOSOKAWA, Nagayoshi MIYOSHI, and Naganori YUSA, and was killed in the battle.

He schemed but failed to retake Takaya-jo Castle, and even though he fought against the bakufu's hunting army in the battle of Kawachi Taiheiji, he was defeated by the joint army of Harumoto HOSOKAWA, Nagayoshi MIYOSHI and Naganori YUSA, and was killed in the battle.

He failed in his scheme of retaking Takayajo Castle; and even though he fought against the bakufu's hunting army in the battle of Kawachi Taiheiji, he was defeated by the joint army of Harumoto HOSOKAWA, Nagayoshi MIYOSHI and Naganori YUSA, and killed in the battle.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 乱世における表立った活動期間は10年余ながら、政争の嗅覚に優れた上に敵対者を陥れる奸知にも長け、混乱する畿内を生き抜いた。
sen.e: Even though his period of conspicuous activities in turbulent period was little over ten years, with his superior sense of smell in political strife and shrewd cunningness to entrap opposing enemies, he lived through confused Kinai region.

Even though his period of conspicuous activity in a turbulent period lasted slightly more than ten years, with his keen nose for political unrest and the cunning with which he entrapped opposing enemies, he lived through the confusion of the Kinai region.

Even though his period of conspicuous activity in a turbulent times lasted slightly more than ten years, he had keen nose for political unrest and was cunning enough to entrap opposing enemies, he lived through the confusion of the Kinai region.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: しかも、その形振り構わぬ鬼謀によって、畿内の混乱に拍車を掛けたとも言える奸雄であった。
sen.e: Moreover, with fiendish intrigue without care about how it looks, he can be said as a crafty hero who spurred on the confusion in Kinai region.
Moreover, despite the appearance of such fiendish intrigue, it can be said that he was a crafty hero who incited the confusion of the Kinai region.
Moreover, with his fiendish plan without regard to its appearance, it can be said that he was a crafty hero who incited the confusion of the Kinai region.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: ただし、その処世術の源泉である鬼謀が振るわなくなると、脆かった。
sen.e: However, when his fiendish intrigue, a source of his success in life, didn't go well, he was frail.
However, without such fiendish intrigue, which had been a source of his success in life, he was frail.
However, without such fiendish plan which had been a source of his success in life, he was frail.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 死後
sen.e: After his death
After his death
After his death

sen.j: 長政と共に一族の多くが戦死、二上山城や信貴山城などもまもなく落城し、長政の勢力は消滅したが、その残党は旧細川高国の残党と結びつき、その数ヶ月後には細川氏綱を盟主として挙兵し、細川氏綱細川氏綱の乱が勃発する。
sen.e: Many members of the clan was killed in the battle along with Nagamasa, Nijozan-jo Castle and Shingisan-jo Castle soon fell and the power of Nagamasa was vanished, but its remnants got united with remnants of former Takakuni HOSOKAWA, and after several months, they raised an army with Ujitsuna HOSOKAWA as their leader, and Ujitsuna HOSOKAWA Rebellion broke out.

Many members of the clan were killed in the battle along with Nagamasa, whereupon Nijozan-jo Castle and Shingisan-jo Castle fell and the power of Nagamasa vanished, but the remnants combined with those of the former Takakuni HOSOKAWA, and after several months they raised an army with Ujitsuna HOSOKAWA as their leader, and the Ujitsuna HOSOKAWA Rebellion erupted.

A lot of members of the clan were killed in the battle as well as Nagamasa, whereupon Nijozanjo Castle and Shingisanjo Castle fell and the power of Nagamasa vanished; but the remnants combined with those of the former Takakuni HOSOKAWA, and several months later, the Ujitsuna HOSOKAWA Rebellion erupted as they raised an army with Ujitsuna HOSOKAWA as their leader.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: また、長政の没後の大和においては筒井順昭が台頭したが、その勢力を抑えるために長慶が派遣した部将が松永久秀である。
sen.e: Also, as for the Yamato after Nagamasa's death, Junsho TSUTSUI gained power, and busho (military commander) sent by Nagayoshi to suppress that power was Hisahide MATSUNAGA.
Also, as for the Yamato after Nagamasa's death, Junsho TSUTSUI gained power, and the busho (military commander) sent by Nagayoshi to suppress that power was Hisahide MATSUNAGA.
After Nagamasa's death, Junsho TSUTSUI gained power in Yamato, and the military commander Hisahide MATSUNAGA was sent by Nagayoshi to suppress that power.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。
